_header: Will ye I-hearen of twelfth day
_description: Ballad of Twelfth Day, the story of the Magi and Herod — ten 4-line stanzas (long lines usually with medial rhyme), or ten 8-line stanzas, abababab

CamTCC323.Note:
Four stanzas only in a faint scribbling, now erased and mostly
                    illegible.
CamTCC323.Editions:
Greg,  Walter Wilson. 
             “A Ballad of Twelfth Day.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 64-7; 9 (1914): 235-6: 235.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 185-6.
